title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, with a $100,000 payment for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or designated operations. The "HEROES Act of 2005" provides a $100,000 death gratuity for combat-related deaths or designated operations, with adjustments for increases in basic pay rates. The "HEROES Act of 2005" provides a $100,000 death gratuity for combat-related deaths or designated operations, with adjustments for increases in basic pay rates. Subsection (1)(B) is amended to include death gratuities under subsections (a) and (c). Subsection (a) is further amended to adjust gratuities under subsection (d). Additionally, an additional gratuity is provided for deaths before the effective date for certain members of the Armed Forces. The Secretary of the military department shall pay a death gratuity in addition to the one under title 10, United States Code, for members of the Armed Forces who died as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom before the enactment of the Act. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is provided to beneficiaries of members of the Armed Forces who died as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom before the enactment of the Act. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is provided to beneficiaries entitled under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, in cases of a member's death. If there are multiple beneficiaries, the amount each receives is based on the ratio of their regular military death gratuity share to the total amount payable. The additional death gratuity is calculated based on the share of the regular military death gratuity payable to each beneficiary in cases of a member's death. The additional death gratuity is defined as the death gratuity provided under paragraph (1), while the regular military death gratuity refers to a death gratuity payable under sections 1475 through 1477 of title 10, United States Code. Enhancements to Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance are detailed in Section 3. Increased maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member. Additional coverage is available for members covered by subsection (e) or making specific elections. Increased maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 for members covered by subsection (e) or making specific elections. Additional coverage is available for members serving in certain areas or operations. The subsection (e) of the Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been amended to provide additional coverage for members who die as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred while serving in designated combat operations or zones. Former members whose death is directly related to injuries or illnesses from serving in these designated areas are also covered. The Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been amended to provide $150,000 of additional coverage for members who die as a result of injuries or illnesses incurred while serving in designated combat operations or zones. Former members are also covered if their death is directly related to injuries or illnesses from serving in these designated areas. The total insurance payable for a member may not exceed $400,000. The insurance coverage for members under the Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is limited to $400,000. During designated operations, $150,000 of insurance coverage costs are covered and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. The insurance coverage for members under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is limited to $400,000. During designated operations, $150,000 of insurance coverage costs are covered and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. Amendments have been made to funding and contributions for insurance costs. Amendments have been made to insurance coverage for members under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance, increasing the limit to $400,000. During designated operations, $150,000 of insurance coverage costs are covered and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. Coordination with Veterans' Group Life Insurance has also been adjusted. Amendments to Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance have increased the coverage limit to $400,000. Regulations now require notice to be given to a member's spouse if the member elects not to be insured or chooses a lower coverage amount. Amendments to Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance now require notice to be given to a member's spouse if the member elects not to be insured or chooses a lower coverage amount, with the spouse's written consent required for any such election. Amendments to Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance now require written consent from a member's spouse for any changes to insurance coverage or beneficiary designations. The effective date for these amendments is 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
